data.title: Files restored via hot exit loose their "deleted from disk" label

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Similar to #23350, but the dirty file case

* Configure the workbench with `"workbench.editor.closeOnFileDelete": false`, `"files.autoSave": "off"`
* Open a file in vscode, **do some edits and do not save the file**
* delete the file on disk (outside vscode)
* the file remains with the label "deleted from disk"
* close/reload the workbench
* hot exit explains that it will take care of things
* the file is restored, but the label "deleted from disk" is no longer in the file tab

data.title: Keep buffer of deleted files around between workbench restarts

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #23242

* Configure the workbench with `"workbench.editor.closeOnFileDelete": false`, `"files.autoSave": "off"`
* Open a file in vscode, do some edits and save the file
* delete the file on disk (outside vscode)
* the file remains with the label "delted from disk"
* close/reload the workbenc
* the file is now lost

data.title: Cannot save file "deleted from disk"
data.body:
Testing #23242

* have `"workbench.editor.closeOnFileDelete": false`, `"files.autoSave": "afterDelay"`
* open a file in the workbench
* delete the file on disk outside vscode
* the file remains in the tab, with the extra label "deleted from disk"

* It is not clear how to restore the file. Ctrl+S does not restore the file. Doing an edit and pressing Ctrl+S seems to be the only way to restore it

data.title: Full screen + windows virtual desktop

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10240
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.44|
|vscode-todo-highlight|wayou|0.4.5|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file in VSCode
2. Put VSCode in full screen with F11
3. Switch multiple time of virtual desktop on Windows 10

Sometimes, the VSCode's windows change of desktop too. VSCode's window follow my desktop's change. 

Reproduced at work and at home, not same extensions but same software version and OS.

data.title: Hitting escape while dragging selection should cancel the drag operation
data.body:
Testing #23329

* enable `editor.dragAndDrop`
* begin dragging
* hit escape
* drag and drop should be canceled.

data.title: [Insiders] File icons missing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider (Commit d489c30378579fc4980d5bc272c7eb65a7c576ab)
- OS Version: Windows Server 2008 R2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Visual Studio Code
2. Select File -> Preferences -> File Icon Theme
3. Select "Minimal (Visual Studio Code)"

The space for the icons is now present but the icons itself are missing. The debug console shows the following error messages:
```
/C:/Program%20Files%20(x86)Microsoft%20VS%20Code%20Insidersresourcespp%0Extensionstheme-defaults%0Fileiconsimagesocument_16x.svg:1 GET file:///C:/Program%20Files%20(x86)Microsoft%20VS%20Code%20Insidersresourcespp%0Extensionstheme-defaults%0Fileiconsimagesocument_16x.svg net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND
/C:/Program%20Files%20(x86)Microsoft%20VS%20Code%20Insidersresourcespp%0Extensionstheme-defaults%0Fileiconsimages%0FolderOpen_16x.svg:1 GET file:///C:/Program%20Files%20(x86)Microsoft%20VS%20Code%20Insidersresourcespp%0Extensionstheme-defaults%0Fileiconsimages%0FolderOpen_16x.svg net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND
/C:/Program%20Files%20(x86)Microsoft%20VS%20Code%20Insidersresourcespp%0Extensionstheme-defaults%0Fileiconsimages%0Folder_16x.svg:1 GET file:///C:/Program%20Files%20(x86)Microsoft%20VS%20Code%20Insidersresourcespp%0Extensionstheme-defaults%0Fileiconsimages%0Folder_16x.svg net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND
```

The issue is not limited to the built-in icon set but also occurs when using a different plugin for icons (in my case, [https://github.com/hellopao/vscode-seti-icons.git](seti-icons)). The files are located in the given folders, albeit the mentioned folders above are not completly correct (I am not sure if that is the real issue or if there is some problem with the console output). The issue is also not caused by an extension as running VS code using the `code-insiders --disable-extensions` command yields the same result.

data.title: Why must the renderer be restarted to enable ts logging?
data.body:
re #23187

It's not clear to me why the renderer process must be restarted to apply the `tsserver.log`-setting? Wrt the main side and extension host the new setting or its new value will appear without a restart. If tsserver requires a restart to apply the setting only tsserver should be restarted and not the whole renderer.

data.title: tssserver.log enabled installation wide
data.body:
re #23187

* have a small workspace without settings
* look at server log, get prompted about missing setting, follow steps
* üêõ the setting is stored globally enabled logging for *all* my ts project

data.title: Feature request: Lazy QuickPickList
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Linux

I would like to have an autocomplete QuickPickList. Is this possible right now? As far as I know the items need to be available in advance right now, right?
I would like to have it for this feature: KnisterPeter/vscode-github#84

I could think it would be a useful addition to other plugins as well.

data.title: Cannot view entire detail string in code completion if there is no associated documentation
data.body:
If the completion item has documentation, the entire detail string can be viewed by expanding the completion item by hitting `Ctrl-Space`. When there is no documentation, `Ctrl-Space` does not work and the full detail string cannot be viewed.

`Ctrl-Space` should expand the completion item if the detail string gets elided.

Example for clarity:

Unexpandable entry with no docs (unable to view entire detail string):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/356714/24390090/58dc0cdc-133b-11e7-8cd4-19c865ebe2a0.png)

Expandable entry since it has docs:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/356714/24390159/d82259b0-133b-11e7-8b0e-8a5f870e8c01.png)

- VSCode Version:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/356714/24390071/3dcbce28-133b-11e7-9e5d-20a5649cb13e.png)
- OS Version: Win10

data.title: onDidChangeConfiguration should contain parameters that changed in the payload
data.body:
The onDidChangeConfiguration event should return what configuration elements changed.

Vim extension is using onDidChangeConfiguration to detect when a user makes a settings change.  If the event returned which actual elements changed, then we could filter out events we don't care about.

Without this information, I am forced to parse the entire configuration which will have a performance impact due to the size and number of configuration options checked.

data.title: Add an configure options let us disable GPU hard ware accelerate
data.body:
RFC: Add an configure options let us disable GPU hard ware accelerate

while running vscode inside virtual machine, or VPS, it does not has a modern GPU. so we should disable GPU hardware accelerate for VSCode.

Or VSCode very slow .

would you please provided us an option / configure to control it?

data.title: Extensions: Possible to extend navigation and combine with TextDocumentContentProviders?
data.body:
I'm in the middle of drafting an extension and was wondering if it's possible to expand the main left-hand navigation (menu item) and combine it with the TextDocumentContentProvider API, which allow custom HTML content to be injected. 

A hybrid of [previewhtml-sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/master/previewhtml-sample) and [tree-explorer-sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/master/tree-explorer-sample), but without the tree view, so to say?

![vs code extension](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/173559/24383745/bbada0dc-1313-11e7-9542-ff41fecf5f19.png)

data.title: Test: encoding auto detection
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5388

- [x] Windows - @gregvanl 
- [x] Linux - @roblourens 
- [x] Mac - @joaomoreno  

We are now using the [jschardet](https://github.com/aadsm/jschardet) library to try to guess the encoding from the contents of a file. As a preparation for testing, try to get some text files in the [supported encodings](https://github.com/aadsm/jschardet#supported-charsets). There is a [shift-jis](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/test/node/mime/fixtures/some.shiftjis.txt) file checked in that is known to work but other encodings would also be interesting.

---

From @joaomoreno

> I've created this repository with several encoding samples:
>
> https://github.com/joaomoreno/encodings

---

There are **two scenarios** to test:

From the new `files.autoGuessEncoding` setting:
* verify that the `files.encoding` setting is still being used as long as `files.autoGuessEncoding` is not enabled
* verify that encoding is detected from the file if possible once `files.autoGuessEncoding` is enabled and you try with files that use a specific encoding not set as configured workspace encoding (e.g. `shift-jis`)
* verify that the configured encoding is used (or `utf8` by default) if the detection is not returning any more specialized encoding (in particular, opening an `ASCII` file should show you `utf8`)

From the encoding selector picker:
* we now guess the encoding from the currently active file as soon as you open the encoding picker (either when chosing "Reopen with encoding" or "Save with encoding")
* verify that when the encoding is detected and it differs from the configured encoding, you see it showing up first
* verify that you do not see the hint about the guessed encoding when the configured encoding matches the detected one (e.g. you set `files.encoding` to `shift-jis`)
* verify you do not end up with duplicate encodings (guessed, and from the list)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/24383647/08c18e02-1313-11e7-8e2c-a5794d271384.png)
